article_node.title: Retail CEOs Try to Project a Sense of Control at the Goldman Sachs Conference
article_node.summary: Retail CEOs at the Goldman Sachs conference emphasized control amid tariff and economic uncertainty. Walmart’s Doug McMillon highlighted a low‑price strategy, e‑commerce expansion, and AI adoption, while PVH’s Stefan Larsson and Levi Strauss & Co. outlined product innovation and marketing momentum to drive revenue. Levi’s plans to sustain growth through high‑profile events, and PVH nudged up its revenue outlook despite tariff challenges. Overall, executives stressed resilience and focus on product, pricing, and digital channels to navigate macro pressures.
